title: Synthetic Recap
body:
SAN ANTONIO — In a game defined by a singular, colossal performance, David Robinson didn't just lead the San Antonio Spurs to victory; he authored a masterpiece of individual dominance. The Admiral steered his ship to a commanding 100-87 victory over the Houston Rockets, but the final score was merely a footnote to his historic 41-point, 24-rebound tour de force.

From the opening tip, Robinson was an unstoppable force, operating with a blend of grace and power that the Rockets had no answer for. He owned the painted area, converting with a surgeon’s precision en route to his staggering final line. Each rebound was snatched with authority, and every one of his 41 points chipped away at Houston’s resolve, turning their defensive schemes into mere suggestions.

While Robinson’s supporting cast provided crucial assistance—with Avery Johnson’s 15 points and 8 assists directing traffic and Sean Elliott adding 15 more—this night belonged unequivocally to the Spurs’ center. The Rockets, led by 22 points from Clyde Drexler and a 16-point, 14-rebound effort from Charles Barkley, simply found themselves overwhelmed by a force of nature they could not contain.

In the end, the stat sheet told the entire story: a legend at the peak of his powers, carrying his team on his back. Robinson’s 41 and 24 was not just a win; it was a statement, a performance for the ages that echoed through the Alamodome and cemented his place among the game's all-time greats.
